Name: Reporting of foreclosing residential properties to council members.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting of foreclosing residential properties to council members

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Housing Preservation and Development to report foreclosure data collected under § 27-2109.1 of the Administrative Code to each Council Member, as relevant to their specific districts.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subdivision a of section 27-2109.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new paragraph 4 to read as follows: 
      4. The department shall, on a quarterly basis, report to each council member a list of all properties in such member's district, identified by block and lot number, along with the name, mailing address and telephone number of the mortgagee plaintiff that issued the notice pursuant to paragraph 1 of this subdivision.  
      � 2. This local law takes effect 90 days after it becomes law.
